definition: special train/abbr. for 專門列車|专门列车[zhuan1 men2 lie4 che1]
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row

sentences.english: She ended up aboard the Orient Express, headed for the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 她最后登上了“东方快车”专列，远赴中东。

sentences.english: Some proposals are given to perfect and develop the special train further.
sentences.chinese: 为进一步促进行包专列的完善和发展，提出了建议。

sentences.english: We have to fit the special train into the timetable.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须得把这专列安排进火车行车时刻表。

sentences.english: They provided special trains for the guests.
sentences.chinese: 他们为客人准备了专列。

sentences.english: When the condition is mature, the hearing system can be specially listed in Administrative Procedure Law.
sentences.chinese: 条件成熟时可将听证制度专列于《行政程序法》之中。

sentences.english: All of the trains have arrived at Xining Railway Station.
sentences.chinese: 目前这些专列已全部到达西宁车站待命。

definition: (of a bus, train etc) to leave for/heading for
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
to ride as a passenger/to travel by (car, plane etc)
green train (slow, noisy, unairconditioned train with forest green livery and yellow trim that ran on the Chinese railway system from the 1950s, phased out in the early 21st century)
